result.execSummary:
The defendant Lester Francis Moesch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court approved electronic monitoring subject to HOC screening.
Court did not oppose transfer of probation to another County within the State of Wisconsin.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
All Court costs, fees and surcharegs as to all counts:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment or school.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes: STAYED: to be used at agent's discretion.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court approved electronic monitoring subject to HOC screening.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 19 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lester Francis Moesch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve NINETEEN (19) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for NINETEEN (19) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve NINE (9) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for ONE HUNDRED AND TEN (110) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court did not oppose transfer of Probation to another County within the State of Wisconsin.
* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges AS TO ALL COUNTS be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

State moved to REVOKE the Agreement.  State requested Defendant be REMANDED pending a Sentencing date.  Defense advised that Defendant has had circumstances that MAY merit an extension of the DPA. On motion of the Defense,  Court took the State's motion to revoke under ADVISEMENT at this time.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br.33 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lester Francis Moesch in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 12/15/2014 at 8:30 am.  aw  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Lester Francis Moesch in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for DPA hearing.  Defendant needs to be interviewed by the Day Reporting Center.  Case adjourned for the last time for a DPA.  Court also addresses Justice Point letter.  Defendant to let any doctor know he has this pending case.  Defendant was suppose to have a doctor fill out an physician disclosure form, in which he did not do.  Defendant unaware of Justice Point giving him the form.  Case passed for Justice Point worker to appear.  Case resumed.  Justice Point worker, Chelsee in court.  Justice Point made record as to giving him the form.  Defendant to have doctor sign form by next Wednesday, or court will issue a warrant, bail will be modified, and court WILL NOT APPROVE a DPA.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 10/22/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Lester Francis Moesch in court with attorney Donald C Dudley.  Antonella Aleman and Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel is wondering if a DPA will still be offered.  State may still offer a DPA.  Court will not approve a DPA if defendant misses any appointments with Justice Point or tests positive for opiates.  Defendant wants a DPA and stated he would not use any opiates.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 8/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court increases defendant's supervision with Justice Point to INTENSIVE.  This is the final adjournment.  Court will not approve a DPA if not resolved on the next court date.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lester Francis Moesch in court with attorney Donald C Dudley.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defendant has not had TAD evaluation done yet.  Court will not approve DPA if defendant does not appear for TAD evaluation on May 6th, or if he tests positive for opiates without a current valid prescription.  Defendant informed the court that he took two pills this morning for pain.  Defendant did not get a new prescription.  Court orders defendant to have a valid current prescription within 30 days of any controlled substance he may take.  Defendant also to advise any defendant of this case pending.  Court orders defendant's supervision increased to INTENSIVE with Justice Point.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 6/25/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
